Midas Documentation » SECTION 5: Run Control » Run Control Programs » mhttpd: the MIDAS Web-based Run Control utility

Slow Control page



Introduction

The Slow Control page refers to the specific display of a Slow Control Equipment (see Slow Control System). This is a special Equipment page that may be accessed from the main status page by clicking on the Equipment Hyperlink. The Slow Control page will show a parameter table (such as those shown below). Parameters that are editable will be hyperlinked for parameter modification. This option is possible only if the parameter names have a particular name syntax.

Name Syntax for Slow Control Page

The name syntax is similar to that already described on the Equipment Page, where the Equipment variables are located in the /Equipment/<equipment-name>/Variables subtree with the matching information defined under the /Equipment/<equipment-name>/Settings subtree. Additinally, for a Slow Control Equipment each variable in the table may be editable depending on the following rules :

  • If the variable name is defined under the "Settings/" directory
    1. as one of the following names, it will be editable by default:
      • in a "Demand" array or
      • in an "Output" array or
      • as "D_<var_name>"
  1. the variable is ALSO defined under the array"Settings/Editable[]"
    • it will be editable.

This information will be combined to compose a table. 

[local:Default:S]/>cd Equipment/MSCB/Settings/
[local:Default:S]Settings>ls
[local:Default:S]Settings>ls
Names
                                Drift Voltage (KV)
                                Drift Current (uA)
                                uC Temperature (C)
DD
Offset
                                0
                                1
                                1
Gain
                                0
                                3
                                4
Editable                        Gain




Slow control Equipment page.
